00017 =head1 AnswerHints()
00018 
00019 This is an answer-checker post-filter that allows you to produce
00020 additional error messages for incorrect answers.  You can trigger
00021 a message for a single answer, a collection of answers, or via a
00022 subroutine that determines the condition for the message.
00023 
00024 Note that this filter only works for MathObjects answer checkers.
00025 
00026 The answer hints are given as a pair using => with the right-hand
00027 side being the answer message and the left-hand side being one of
00028 three possibilities:  1) the value that triggers the message,
00029 2) a reference to an array of values that trigger the message, or
00030 3) a code reference to a subtroutine that accepts tthe correct
00031 answer, the student's answer, and the answer hash, and returns
00032 1 or 0 depending on whether the message should or should not be
00033 displayed.  (See the examples below.)
00034 
00035 The right-hand side can be either the message string itself, or
00036 a referrence to an array where the first element is the message
00037 string, and the remaining elements are name-value pairs that
00038 set options for the message.  These can include:
00039 
00040 =over
00041 
00042 =item C<S<< checkCorrect => 0 or 1 >>>
00043 
00044 1 means check for messages even
00045 if the answer is correct.
00046 Default: 0
00047 
00048 =item C<S<< replaceMessage => 0 or 1 >>>
00049 
00050 1 means it's OK to repalce any
00051 message that is already in place
00052 in the answer hash.
00053 Default: 0
00054 
00055 =item C<S<< checkTypes => 0 or 1 >>>
00056 
00057 1 means only perform the test
00058 if the student answer is the
00059 same type as the correct one.
00060 Default: 1
00061 
00062 =item C<S<< score => number >>>
00063 
00064 Specifies the score to use if
00065 the message is triggered (so that
00066 partial credit can be given).
00067 Default: keep original score
00068 
00069 =item C<S<< cmp_options => [...] >>>
00070 
00071 provides options for the cmp routine
00072 used to check if the student answer
00073 matches these answers.
00074 Default: []
00075 
00076 =back
00077 
00078 If more than one message matches the student's answer, the first
00079 one in the list is used.
00080 
00081 Example:
00082 
00083     ANS(Vector(1,2,3)->cmp(showCoordinateHints=>0)->withPostFilter(AnswerHints(
00084         Vector(0,0,0) => "The zero vector is not a valid solution",
00085         "-<1,2,3>" => "Try the opposite direction",
00086         "<1,2,3>" => "Well done!",
00087         ["<1,1,1>","<2,2,2>","<3,3,3>"] => "Don't just guess!",
00088         sub {
00089             my ($correct,$student,$ans) = @_;
00090             return $correct . $student == 0;
00091         } => "Your answer is perpendicular to the correct one",
00092         Vector(1,2,3) => [
00093             "You have the right direction, but not length",
00094             cmp_options => [parallel=>1],
00095         ],
00096         0 => ["Careful, your answer should be a vector!", checkTypes => 0, replaceMessage => 1],
00097         sub {
00098             my ($correct,$student,$ans) = @_;
00099             return norm($correct-$student) < .1;
00100         } => ["Close!  Keep trying.", score => .25],
00101     )));
00102 
00103 =cut
00104 
00105 sub _answerHints_init {}
00106 
00107 sub AnswerHints {
00108   return (sub {
00109     my $ans = shift; $ans->{_filter_name} = "Answer Hints Post Filter";
00110     my $correct = $ans->{correct_value};
00111     my $student = $ans->{student_value};
00112     Value::Error("AnswerHints can only be used with MathObjects answer checkers") unless ref($correct);
00113     return $ans unless ref($student);
00114 
00115     while (@_) {
00116       my $wrongList = shift; my $message = shift; my @options;
00117       ($message,@options) = @{$message} if ref($message) eq 'ARRAY';
00118       my %options = (
00119         checkCorrect => 0,
00120         replaceMessage => 0,
00121     checkTypes => 1,
00122         score => undef,
00123         cmp_options => [],
00124         @options,
00125       );
00126       next if $options{checkType} && $correct->type ne $student->type;
00127       $wrongList = [$wrongList] unless ref($wrongList) eq 'ARRAY';
00128       foreach my $wrong (@{$wrongList}) {
00129     if (ref($wrong) eq 'CODE') {
00130       if (($ans->{score} < 1 || $options{checkCorrect}) &&
00131           ($ans->{ans_message} eq "" || $options{replaceMessage}) &&
00132           &$wrong($correct,$student,$ans)) {
00133         $ans->{ans_message} = $ans->{error_message} = $message;
00134         $ans->{score} = $options{score} if defined $options{score};
00135         last;
00136       }
00137     } else {
00138       $wrong = Value::makeValue($wrong);
00139       if (($ans->{score} < 1 || $options{checkCorrect} || AnswerHints::Compare($correct,$wrong,$ans)) &&
00140           ($ans->{ans_message} eq "" || $options{replaceMessage}) &&
00141           AnswerHints::Compare($wrong,$student,$ans,@{$options{cmp_options}})) {
00142         $ans->{ans_message} = $ans->{error_message} = $message;
00143         $ans->{score} = $options{score} if defined $options{score};
00144         last;
00145       }
00146     }
00147       }
00148     }
00149     return $ans;
00150   },@_);
00151 }
00152 
00153 package AnswerHints;
00154 
00155 #
00156 #  Calls the answer checker on two values with a copy of the answer hash
00157 #  and returns true if the two values match and false otherwise.
00158 #
00159 sub Compare {
00160   my $self = shift; my $other = shift; my $ans = shift;
00161   $ans = bless {%{$ans},@_}, ref($ans);  # make a copy
00162   $ans->{typeError} = 0; $ans->{ans_message} = $ans->{error_message} = ""; $ans->{score} = 0;
00163   if (sprintf("%p",$self) ne sprintf("%p",$ans->{correct_value})) {
00164     $ans->{correct_ans} = $self->string;
00165     $ans->{correct_value} = $self;
00166     $ans->{correct_formula} = Value->Package("Formula")->new($self);
00167   }
00168   if (sprintf("%p",$other) ne sprintf("%p",$ans->{student_value})) {
00169     $ans->{student_ans} = $other->string;
00170     $ans->{student_value} = $other;
00171     $ans->{student_formula} = Value->Package("Formula")->new($other);
00172   }
00173   $self->cmp_preprocess($ans);
00174   $self->cmp_equal($ans);
00175   $self->cmp_postprocess($ans) if !$ans->{error_message} && !$ans->{typeError};
00176   return $ans->{score} >= 1;
00177 }

00179 1;
